title: PSA: Read threads please
body:
There are a number of threads being made saying the exact same things and getting no comments, upvotes, even views. Please read the forum before making a new thread. If there is a particular feature we want to get implemented, removed, or modified, Riot is going to have a hard time knowing when we have 100 threads that have no upvotes/comments. If we have one or two with 300 upvotes / 100 comments we're more likely to see a red-comment and get some positive changes made. 

Thanks!

replies.body:
That is some good advice.

Even when not all the threads get a reply, I can assure you that there is a lot of Rioters going through the boards.

Even if there are a lot of Rioters lurking in the boards, do they still seriously consider threads that don't get noticed and popular? I'm afraid that those get tossed aside since they don't get upvotes or views.
I try to read threads at random. Just because a thread doesn't get upvotes doesn't mean it's not valuable feedback.

> [{quoted}](name=Shineui,realm=NA,application-id=2E4zVIwd,discussion-id=4FmEzO8J,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2016-11-09T08:50:39.076+0000)
>
> Even if there are a lot of Rioters lurking in the boards, do they still seriously consider threads that don't get noticed and popular? I'm afraid that those get tossed aside since they don't get upvotes or views.

That would depend on what exactly is being said. I've seen some threads with no comments or upvotes that gets a red-comment agreeing with the post and that a change is on it's way. The point remains that it's more likely to slip through the cracks if it's a post not being acknowledged by our community.

It might be a pain but is there an option to find the first thread and take the ones that are similar then make a sub-post within that that links everyone to said threads?

You are not deleting the repeats but combining threads under the main one?

IDK in my roleplay sites that's what I usually do.
